The below zero temperatures mean one thing: gimme all the pasta. DUH. Enter this One-Pot Creamy French Onion Pasta Bake. Here’s the deal: everything gets started in one pot and then ENDS in the very same pot. YES. Dishes be gone!! Happy weekend cooking!
.
.
4 tablespoons butter
2-3 sweet onions
1 tablespoon brown sugar
1 tablespoon worcestershire sauce
1 cup red wine
8 ounces cremini mushrooms, sliced
salt + pepper, to taste
2 cloves garlic, minced or grated
3 cups low sodium chicken broth + 3/4 cups water
1 pound of your favorite short cut pasta
2 bay leaves
2-3 fresh thyme sprigs
1 1/4 cups heavy cream
pinch of cayenne pepper
6 ounces gruyere cheese, shredded
.
.
Heat a large pot over medium-high heat and add the butter. Add the onions + brown sugar and cook about 10 minutes, stirring frequently, until softened. At this point you want to slowly add the Worcestershire sauce and the wine, let them cook into the onions, add more and continue to cook.
Preheat the the broiler to high.

Toss the mushroom and garlic in with the caramelized onions, season with salt + pepper, cook another 3-4 minutes or until the mushrooms are soft.Pour in the chicken broth + water and bring to a boil. Add your pasta, bay leaves and thyme, cook, stirring often until most of the liquid has been soaked up by the pasta and the pasta is al dente. If you feel your pasta needs more water to continue cooking, add around 1/2 cup. Stir in the cream and a pinch of cayenne pepper. Stir in half the gruyere cheese. Cook 2 minutes and then remove from the heat. Top with the remaining cheese and place under the broiler for 1-2 minutes until the cheese is melted. .
.

Today is the day! The Half Baked Harvest Cookbook is officially out for the world to read and cook from! 🤗😲🤗I can hardly believe it! We’ve all only been waiting for this day to come for just over two years now. Honestly, it still has not really hit me that I actually have a cookbook. I mean, me? A cookbook? I could not be more excited or happy. My hope is that you all love the cookbook as much as I do! HUGE thank you to all the incredible and talented people who have made this book come to life! Happy cooking! 😘

Best EASY Greek Sheet Pan Chicken Souvlaki and Potatoes. All made on ONE pan and done in under and hour. And it’s a healthy, well-balanced meal too. Winner. Recipe below.
1 1/2 pounds boneless chicken breast
extra virgin olive oil
juice of 1 lemon + 1 lemon sliced
2 tablespoons balsamic vinegar
1 tablespoon chopped fresh dill
1 tablespoon chopped fresh oregano
1 tablespoon paprika
2 cloves garlic, minced or grated
kosher salt and pepper
1 pound russet potatoes, cut into 1 inch chunks
1-2 red bell peppers, sliced
1 sweet onion, sliced
8 ounces feta, cubed
1/2 cup oil packed sun-dried tomatoes
1/3 cup kalamata olives, pitted
.
Combine the chicken, olive oil, the lemon juice, balsamic vinegar, dill, oregano, paprika, garlic and a large pinch of both salt and pepper. Toss. Add the veggies and toss with olive oil, salt and pepper. Arrange everything in an even layer. Add the lemon slices. Roast at 425 for 40-45 minutes until the chicken is cooked through.
.
Combine the feta, sun-dried tomatoes and their oil, and the olives in a bowl. Toss.
.
To serve, top the chicken with the feta mix and tzatziki. Eat!

Hey, hi! Meet your new favorite summer salad! It’s packed with peaches, basil and crispy prosciutto…and cheese (I am obsessed?) 😍😍 In an effort not to turn the oven on, this entire salad is made on the grill and ready for eating in about 30 minutes. It’s full of protein, greens, and sweet summer time fruit 💯 SOO good. And um, that grilled basil chicken?! <-- summer chicken perfection right there! 😎
.
*here is what you need*
4 ripe peaches
1/2 cup balsamic vinegar
1 tablespoon honey
1 pound boneless skinless chicken breasts
3 ounces prosciutto
1 tablespoon olive oil
2 tablespoons fresh chopped basil
1 tablespoon fresh chopped oregano
Kosher salt + pepper
6 cups fresh arugula or baby spinach
1 cup cherry tomatoes
6 ounces fresh mozzarella or burrata cheese
1 avocado
1/3 cup toasted seeds (such as sunflower pumpkin, sesame)
* for the balsamic Vinaigrette*
1/4 cup olive oil
1/4 cup balsamic vinegar
2 tablespoons fresh chopped basil
2 teaspoons dijon mustard
Kosher salt + pepper
.
grab the full instructions at the link 👇or use the vid!

Blackberry Lavender White Chocolate Scones. 😋 Buttery, flakey, bursting with sweet blackberries, and studded with white chocolate chips for a little extra fun! Finish with a lavender glaze. 🌺 The Best. Full recipe is on the blog. ✨
.
.
WHAT YOU NEED FOR THE SCONES:
2 1/2 cups all-purpose flour
2 tablespoons granulated sugar
1 tablespoon baking powder
1/2 teaspoon salt
8 tablespoons unsalted butter grated
1 egg
3/4 cup buttermilk + more for brushing
1 tablespoon vanilla extract
1 1/2 cups fresh or frozen blackberries
1/2-1 cup white chocolate chips
.
In a mixing bowl, combine the flour sugar, baking powder, and salt. Add the butter and toss with the flour. Add the egg, buttermilk and vanilla. Mix until just combined. Fold in the blackberries and white chocolate chips.
.
Turn the dough onto a floured surface and then pat into 1-inch-thick square. Cut the dough into 2 inch squares. Place pieces, about 2 inches apart on the prepared baking sheets. Brush each piece with buttermilk. Bake at 400 until golden brown, 15 to 18 minutes.
.
FOR THE GLAZE:
Place the 1/3 cup milk and 2 tablespoons butter in a small saucepan and set over medium heat. Cook until the milk is steaming, but not boiling. Remove from the heat and stir in the 1 tablespoon dried lavender. Cover and steep 5 minutes. Strain. Stir in 1-2 cups powdered sugar. Drizzle the glaze over each scone. ENJOY!!

One pot Greek oregano chicken and orzo with tomatoes in garlic oil 💯💯 did you know you could make your chicken and your pasta in ONE pot?! Well you can and it's pretty freaking delicious. Greek chicken served up over a bed or orzo pasta that taste more like risotto than pasta (yummmm) and finished with fresh heirloom tomatoes...and feta, which I totally forgot to add for the video, BUT you should add plenty of feta because life with feta = happiness 😋
.
*what you need*
extra virgin olive oil
1 pound boneless skinless chicken, cut into bit size pieces
2-3 cloves garlic minced or grated
2 tablespoon balsamic vinegar
1 tablespoon smoked paprika
kosher salt and pepper
1/2 cup fresh oregano, chopped
2 bell peppers, sliced
16 ounces orzo pasta
1 cup olives
crumbled feta cheese
heirloom tomatoes + garlic oil
.
*how to do it*
Add olive oil, chicken +  seasonings to a large skillet and cook until browned. Remove the chicken. To the same skillet, add a little more olive oil and the bell peppers, and cook until just charred. Stir in the orzo and 2 1/2 cups water. Bring to a boil and cook until almost all the water is absorbed and the orzo is creamy. Add back the chicken and top with olives.
.
Serve topped with crumbled feta cheese (trust me, add the cheese) and a side of tomatoes in garlic oil. DIG IN.
.
https://www.halfbakedharvest.com/one-pot-greek-oregano-chicken-and-orzo-with-tomatoes-in-garlic-oil/
.

*I have partnered with @Quaker on this post* Some mornings just require a grab and go breakfast and during the summer overnight oats are my go-to. This very berry overnight oat recipe is made with old fashioned oats, greek yogurt, chia seeds, cinnamon, honey, and topped with bee pollen + tons of fresh berries. Summer breakfast in a jar! .
.
½ cup Quaker® Oats
½ cup milk of choice
1 tablespoon honey, plus more for drizzling
1 tablespoon chia seeds
1 teaspoon vanilla
½ teaspoon ground cinnamon
Pinch sea salt
¼ cup plain greek yogurt
1 cup mixed berries
bee pollen, chia seeds, and hemp seeds, for topping
.
.
Add Quaker Oats to a glass jar. Stir in the milk (or milk alternative), honey, vanilla extract, chia seeds, cinnamon, and salt. Layer with yogurt, berries, and seeds. Drizzle honey on top and refrigerate overnight. Enjoy
.
.

Green Goddess Zucchini Pasta with Fried Halloumi...aka SPRING PASTA! 🌸 💃 With half real deal pasta, half zucchini noodles, "goddess" basil avocado pesto, and FRIED HALLOUMI CHEESE. <--the best. 👊
.
WHAT YOU NEED
1/4 cup tahini (sesame seed paste)
1-2 cloves garlic
1/2 of an avocado or 1 small avocado
2 tablespoons lemon juice
2 tablespoons roasted pistachios
1 1/2 cups fresh basil
1 jalapeño, halved + seeded
1/4 cup olive oil
1/3 cup grated parmesan
salt + pepper to taste
1/2 pound spaghetti
2-3 zucchini, spiralized
8 ounces halloumi cheese, sliced
.
TO MAKE
Combine the tahini, garlic, avocado, lemon juice, pistachios, basil, jalapeño, olive oil, parmesan, and a pinch each of salt and pepper in a food processor. .
Boil pasta, reserving 1 cup of the pasta cooking water. Drain and toss with the zucchini noodles, green sauce, and 1/4 of the pasta cooking water, adding more water of needed to loosen the sauce. .
Fry the halloumi cheese in a little olive oil.
.
Serve the pasta topped with cherry tomatoes, halloumi cheese, sesame seeds and fresh basil. EAT. 😎

I have cheesy pasta things to share today in the form of this Crispy Prosciutto White Lasagna. It’s filled with a creamy Béchamel sauce and layered with spinach, ricotta, provolone, and then topped with prosciutto just before baking, which allows it to get nice and crispy in the oven. So. Good. You need to make this. Preferably very soon or maybe for your next holiday dinner? Either works. Full recipe below. .
1 stick (1/2 cup) butter
2 cloves garlic, minced or grated
1 tsp dried basil
1 tsp dried oregano
1/2 teaspoon kosher salt + pepper
1/4 cup flour
2 cups whole milk
2 cups chicken or veggie broth
1 cup each shredded mozzarella + parmesan
2 cups whole milk ricotta
2 cups shredded provolone
2 packages frozen spinach, thawed and drained
1 box no-boil lasagna noodles
3 ounces prosciutto, torn
.
Melt the butter in a saucepan. Add the garlic, basil, oregano, salt, and pepper and cook 30 seconds. Whisk in the flour and cook for about 1 minute. Add the milk and broth. Bring to a boil and stir for 1 minute. Stir in the mozzarella cheese and 1/2 cup of parmesan cheese. .
Combine the ricotta, provolone and spinach. Spread 1/4 of the cheese sauce in the bottom of a greased baking dish. Top with 3-4 lasagna sheets. Spread with 1/2 the ricotta cheese mixture and then another 1/4 of the cheese sauce. Repeat the layers. Top with the remaining 1/2 cup of parmesan cheese. Arrange the prosciutto on top. Bake at 350, uncovered for 45 minutes. Let stand 20 minutes before serving (right, right). Enjoy!!

Cheddar Cornbread Waffle BLT. These BLT’s are one for the books. And by that, I mean they are life changing --> let’s break this sandwich down piece by piece --> cheddar waffles, chipotle butter, crispy bacon, heirloom tomatoes, arugula, then add avocado, obviously. Drizzle on maple syrup (a must) 😍😍
.
*what you need for the waffles*
1 cup buttermilk
2 eggs
2 tablespoons honey
1 1/2 cup all-purpose flour
1/2 cup cornmeal
2 teaspoons baking powder
1/2 teaspoon salt
1-2 cups shredded cheddar
1 cup corn
1 jalapeño, seeds removed + chopped
.
Whisk together the buttermilk, eggs and honey. Add the flour, cornmeal, baking powder and salt and stir until just combined. Stir in the cheddar cheese, corn and jalapeño. Allow the batter to sit 5-10 minutes the cook waffles according to your waffle iron's directions.
.
Make the chipotle butter. In a small bowl, stir together the 4 tablespoons butter and 2 chopped chipotle peppers.
.
To assemble, spread each warm waffle with chipotle butter and then layer on tomatoes, bacon + arugula. Add another waffle. Top with avocado and finish off with a drizzle of maple syrup (DO IT). EAT! 🙂
.

Spinach and Artichoke Melts...because the weekend is near and good food is needed. Who is with me? Tag all your grilled cheese loving friends and let's do this 👏 ps. that cheese pull at the end? nothing better. .
.
what you need
1 tablespoon butter
1 clove garlic, minced or grated
1 tablespoon flour
1/2-3/4 cup milk
1/2 cup shredded cheddar or parmesan cheese
1/2 cup shredded mozzarella cheese
1/2 cup plain greek yogurt
1/2 teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes (optional)
kosher salt and peper
1/2 cup  frozen chopped spinach, thawed
1 (6.7 ounce) jar marinated artichokes, chopped
8 slices bread
.
Melt butter in a skillet. Add garlic and cook for 30 seconds. Whisk in flour and cook over medium-low heat for another 30 seconds, pour in milk. Stir and cook 1 minute. Add the cheese, yogurt and a pinch each of salt and pepper. Stir until melted. Stir in the spinach and artichokes.
Heat a skillet over medium heat. Butter the outsides of the bread. Spread a good amount the spinach and artichoke mixture on the inside of each slice. Add your top piece of bread. Cook until each side is golden and crisp. EAT!
.
.

Brown Sugar Caramel Oatmeal Cookie Peach Crisp 🍑🍪🍑Yes, PEACH CRISP…with an OATMEAL COOKIE TOPPING…and basically all the vanilla ice cream you can handle. The secret here is brown sugar, butter and super sweet peaches --> just four ingredients. The peaches slowly cook down into the caramel-like sauce, and you guys, the peaches + sauce alone are really something amazing. Even without the crisp topping, the peaches + ice cream…so good...but of course the topping just adds something extra special. Watch vid and see what I am talking about 😋
.
*here is what you need*
5-6 ripe but firm peaches
6 tablespoons softened butter, cubed
1/2 cup packed light brown sugar
2 teaspoons vanilla extract
*Oatmeal Cookie Topping
1 1/2 cups old fashioned oats
3 tablespoons all purpose flour
1/3 cup brown sugar
1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
6 tablespoons softened salted butter, cubed
.
add the peaches, butter, brown sugar, and vanilla to a baking dish and toss.
.
in a bowl, combine the oats, flour, sugar, cinnamon, and butter and mix with hands until the mix is moist. sprinkle evenly over peaches. bake at 350 for 40-45 minutes or until the top is golden and the peaches have created a caramel like sauce that is bubbling (yuummmm). Serve warm with plenty of ice cream. Obviously. 😍
.

FIVE Ingredient Cranberry Brie Cinnamon Sugar Puff Pastry Swirls <--the tittle literally say's it. But also? You need to make these for Thanksgiving (or Christmas). They are the easiest, cheesiest, and most delicious appetizer. Ever. Make them. Full recipe below. .
1 sheet frozen puff pastry, thawed
2-4 tablespoons butter, melted
8 ounces soft brie cheese, cubed
1 cup dried cranberries
2 tablespoons cinnamon sugar
.
Brush the pastry with about a little butter and then sprinkle with a dusting of cinnamon sugar. You can go as heavy or at light as you would like. Arrange the brie over the pastry and sprinkle the cranberries over the brie.
.
Roll the pastry up as tightly as possible. Brush the roll with butter and then sprinkle with cinnamon sugar to coat. Cut into 1/2 inch rounds. .
Place the swirls on a parchment lined baking sheet and bake in a 350 degree oven for 12-15 minutes or until the pastry golden. Serve warm!
.

EASIEST raspberry shortcake ricotta ice cream?! YUMMM 😋 😋 bits of whole raspberries and chunks of buttery biscuits blended into a ricotta based ice cream🍦too good for words. it’s all things perfection. think of it like a frozen shortcake, but better because there’s ricotta cheese involved. you see? SO GOOD 😜
.
BONUS?!? This is a no churn, one blender kind of ice cream 👊ps. that ice cream smashing in the beginning? that's the result of filming all day and wanting to have some fun with the last video. I know it's random, but I kind of love it. And yes, we still at the ice cream!! .
.
16 ounces whole milk ricotta cheese
3/4 cup honey
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
pinch of lemon zest
pinch of flakey sea salt
2 cups whipped cream
1 1/2 cups fresh raspberries
crumbled biscuits (I use 2)
.
combine the ricotta, honey, vanilla, lemon zest, and salt in a blender and pulse until smooth. fold the whipped cream. stir in the berries and crumbled biscuits. transfer to an airtight container. freeze until firm, at least 4 hours. scoop. eat. enjoy!
.
.

Feeling as though this time between Christmas and New Years needs a little Mexican --> enter this Chipotle Adobo Chicken Quesadilla with shredded chipotle chicken, rice, cheese, and topped with @tabasco sauce and fresh mango. Grab the full recipe below.
.
.
2 tablespoons olive oil
1 pound boneless skinless chicken tenders
1 sweet onion, chopped
1 poblano pepper, chopped
1 (14 ounce) can fire roasted diced tomatoes
2 chipotle peppers in adobo, chopped
1 teaspoon chili powder
1 teaspoon dried oregano
1 teaspoon cumin
1 teaspoon kosher salt and pepper
2 tablespoons Tabasco Sauce
1/4 cup fresh cilantro, chopped
8 small corn or flour tortillas
1 cup white or brown rice
1 cup shredded cheddar cheese
.
Sear chicken in olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Add the onions + poblano pepper and cook 3-4 minutes. Add 1/2 cup water, the tomatoes, chipotle peppers, seasonings and Tabasco Sauce. Stir to combine and then simmer 15-20 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and shreds easily. Shred the chicken in the pot. Stir in the cilantro.
.
Lay 4 tortillas flat on a baking sheet and then layer evenly with cheese, rice, and chicken. Add the top tortilla. Transfer to a 450 degree oven and cook for 5-8 minutes, then flip and cook another 5 minutes more, or until the cheese has melted and the tortillas are crisp.
.
Serve the quesadillas topped with diced mango, jalapeños, fresh cilantro, and additional Tabasco Sauce. EAT!

Oatmeal Chocolate Chunk Cookie Peanut Butter Swirled Brownies. 🍫🍪Oatmeal cookie + fudge brownie all swirled together with peanut butter and baked into the perfect dessert bar. A chocolate lovers dream. ✨
.
.
To make the brownie batter: whisk together 10 tablespoons melted butter and 2 ounces melted chocolate. Add 1 cup sugar, 1 tablespoon vanilla and 2 eggs and whisk until smooth. Stir in 1/2 cup cocoa powder, 1/2 cup flour and 1/4 teaspoon salt until smooth and just combined. Add 1/4 cup melted peanut butter and 1/3 cup chopped chocolate and gently stir, leaving a few streaks of peanut butter.
.
To make the oatmeal cookies: In a large mixing bowl, add 1 1/4 cups oatmeal, 1 cup flour, 1/2 cup brown sugar, 1/2 teaspoon baking soda, 1/4 teaspoon salt, 1/2 cup canola oil, 1 egg and 2 teaspoons vanilla and mix until combined and the dough holds together. Mix in 1/2 cup chopped chocolate.
.
To assemble drop dollops of about half the brownie batter into a greased 9x13 inch pan. Sprinkle the oatmeal cookie dough over the brownie batter. Dollop the remaining brownie batter over top the oatmeal cookie dough. Drizzle over 1/4 cup melted  peanut butter.
.
Bake at 350 for about 25-35 minutes. DO NOT OVER BAKE.
.
Enjoy with cold milk. <--a must!

20 Minute Crispy Honey Ginger Salmon 🙃 Sweet, spicy, extra crispy on the outside, but perfectly cooked inside, and all ready in 20 minutes --> SO GOOD. Sometimes life just requires just the easy things 👊
.
*for the salmon*
4 salmon fillets
1 tablespoon sesame oil
2/3 cup honey
2 tablespoons sambal oelek
2 tablespoons low sodium soy sauce
1 inch piece fresh ginger, grated
2 cloves garlic, chopped
zest and juice of lime
*for the Asian summer slaw*
2 tablespoons lime juice
2 tablespoons rice vinegar
1/2 head purple cabbage, shredded
2 nectarines thinly, sliced
1 cup fresh cilantro, chopped
.
Preheat the broiler to high. Rub the salmon all over with sesame oil. Heat a cast iron skillet over medium high heat.
.
In a small bowl, combine honey, sambal oelek, soy sauce, ginger, garlic, lime zest and juice. Pour the sauce into the skillet and allow it to boil for 2-3 minutes. Remove from the heat and add salmon, skin side up. Transfer the skillet to the oven and broil for 2-3minutes.
.
In a medium bowl, combine all the ingredients for the slaw and toss to combine. .
Serve the salmon topped with the slaw and drizzled with any extra sauce in the pan. Enjoy!
.

Giant bowls of cozy, comfort pasta for you today in the form this Golden Sun-Dried Tomato Red lentil Pasta. Full of healthy carbs, vegetables and yup, that crazy popular ingredient of the moment, turmeric, hence the “golden” in the title. It's comfort food in a bowl, but done healthy. Just what you need this winter. Trust me. .
.
1/4 cup extra virgin olive oil
1 sweet onion, chopped
6 cloves garlic, minced or grated
1 tablespoon dried basil
1 tablespoon dried oregano
2 teaspoons ground turmeric
kosher salt and pepper
1 (28 ounce) can fire roasted tomatoes, I like san marzano
1/2 cup oil packed sun-dried tomatoes
1 tablespoon apple cider vinegar
1 (8 ounce) box red lentil pasta or other short cut pasta
.
.
Sauté the onion, garlic, and herbs with the olive oil until fragrant. Add the tomatoes and vinegar. Season with salt and pepper. Simmer 15-20 minutes. .
Boil pasta. Puree the sauce. Divide the pasta among bowls and top with a generous amount of sauce. Top as desired with cheese and herbs. ENJOY!

Crockpot Thai Broccoli Chicken Curry --> reader favorite recipe! You guys love this curry and with good reason. It's so easy, pretty healthy, and SO GOOD. It makes for the perfect cozy winter dinner. Just one thing? Be sure to serve this curry over a bowl of rice, white or brown. Or maybe even some rice noodles. Quinoa works too. You just need some carbs with your curry. Got it? K. Cool. Recipe below. .
.
1 yellow onion, finely diced
6 cloves of garlic, minced or grated
1 inch piece fresh ginger, peeled + grated
1 lemongrass stalk, finely chopped
1/4 cup Thai red curry paste
2 tablespoons fish sauce
2 (14 ounce) cans coconut milk
2 tablespoons honey
1 pound chicken breast, diced
1 bunch broccoli rabe or broccolini
Combine all ingredients in the order listed in you slow cooker. Cook on low for 5-6 hours or on high for 4 hours. Just before serving, stir in 1/4 cup chopped fresh basil or cilantro. .
Serve the curry over a bowl of steamed rice. Top with pomegranate arils. Eat!

Simple Vegetarian Skillet Lasagna...aka the next best thing to a ZERO work lasagna. Read: ONE pot, NO layering lasagna noodles, NO boiling lasagna noodles, made in under one hour and actually a pretty healthy veggie filled meal…if you count cheese as healthy, which you should all know by now that I DO. Duh. <--Friday night cheese and pasta? Well, OK. 🙌
.
.
HOW TO MAKE IT HAPPEN 👇
.
Cook 1 chopped zucchini, 8 ounces sliced mushrooms and 1 chopped red pepper in a large skillet or dutch oven. Drizzle with olive oil and season with kosher salt and  pepper. Add the garlic and cook another minute. Stir in the 1 jar tomato sauce, 1 1/4 cups water and a pinch of crushed red pepper flakes. Stir in the 1/2 cup chopped sun-dried tomatoes, and 1/2 cup dry green lentils. .
Break each 6 ounces of no-boil lasagna noodles into 2-3 pieces and stir them into the sauce. Cook until the noodles are al dente and the lentils are soft, about 15 minutes. If the sauce seems like it is getting too thick, add water to thin.
.
Stir in the 2 cups spinach + 1 cup torn basil. Remove from the heat and add 1 cup shredded mozzarella, 1/2 cups shredded provolone and 1/3 cup parmesan.
.
Bake at 375 for 10 minutes or until the cheese is bubbly. Garnish with basil and parmesan. EATTT.

Sake and Ginger Noodle Stir Fry --> Delicious and so easy to make. It’s takes maybe 30 minutes start to finish and, assuming your family eats seafood, everyone will love it.
Even though this is a bright and healthy meal, it’s still super cozy and perfect for these winter nights. Also, if you have leftovers, you can pack up them up for lunch the next day. Nothing is better than an easy dinner that doubles as the next days lunch too. The best. Full recipe below.
.
.
For the sauce
3/4 cup sake
1/4 cup tablespoons low sodium soy sauce divided
2 tablespoons fresh ginger, grated
2 cloves garlic, minced or grated
2 teaspoons sambal oelek chili paste
2 tablespoons sesame oil
For the Stir Fry
1 1/2 pounds salmon, cut into bit size pieces
6 green onions, chopped
2 bunches broccolini stalks, halved lengthwise
1 1/2 cups frozen edamame
1 (3 ounce) box soba noodles or other noodles
2 tablespoons toasted sesame seeds
1/4 cup roasted cashews
.
.
In a glass jar, combine the sauce ingredients and shake to combine. Drizzle 1/3 of the sauce over the salmon and gently toss. Allow the salmon to sit in the marinade for 10-30 minutes.
.
Cook the noodles according to package directions.
.
Heat about a tablespoon of sesame oil in a wok or high sided skillet over high heat. Remove the salmon from the marinade. Cook the salmon, turning for 2-3 minutes until lightly caramelized. .
Add another tablespoon of oil to the skillet. Add the broccolini, green onions, and edamame, stir fry for 2 minutes . Add the remaining sauce and noodles. Toss well, cook another 3-4 minutes or until warmed throughout. Remove from the heat. Add the salmon. Serve with sesame seeds and cashews. Enjoy!
Good morning!

Crockpot Three Cheese Potatoes. Say hello to your new favorite way to make everyone’s favorite Thanksgiving side dish. You guys, in all honesty, if there was ever a crockpot recipe to know how to make, it has got to be these mashed potatoes. Not only does it free up space on the stove, but it there’s NO BOILING the potatoes and so much less clean up, AND the crockpot will keep your mashers warm until ready to eat, meaning no reheating necessary. Full recipe below!
.
5 pounds russets or yukon gold potatoes, cubed
4 cloves garlic, peeled and smashed
1 cup low sodium chicken broth or water
2 cups whole milk
1 teaspoon kosher salt and pepper
1 cup shredded sharp cheddar cheese
1 cup shredded gruyere cheese
1/2 cup grated parmesan
6 tablespoons butter
1 tablespoon sage
.
Add the potatoes, garlic, chicken broth, 1 cup milk, salt and pepper to the crockpot. Cover and cook on high for 4-5 hours hours or on low for 6-8 hours. When the potatoes are fork tender, add 1/2 cups milk and mash them using a potato masher or a hand held mixer until completely creamy, adding the remaining 1/2 cup milk if needed to thin. Stir in the cheese, cover and cook another 15 minutes or until melted and creamy.
.
In a skillet melt the butter over medium heat until just browned. Stir in the sage and let cook 30 seconds. Pour the browned butter into the warm mashed potatoes. Taste and season with salt and pepper if desired. SERVE!
.

Say hello to the coziest, cutest, homemade Christmas gift, Hot Chocolate on a Candy Cane --> Made using affordable ingredients from @walmart, these are the perfect thing to warm you up this holiday season. Bring on hot chocolate and all the snow. Full recipe below. .
1/2 cup evaporated milk
2 1/2 cups semi-sweet chocolate chips
7 ounces milk chocolate, chopped
2 teaspoons vanilla extract
flaky sea salt
14 ounces highly quality milk chocolate, melted and cooled
12 candy canes
assorted candies, for topping (optional) .
In a saucepan, heat the evaporated milk over medium heat, stirring, often until steaming. Remove from the heat. Stir in the semi-sweet and milk chocolate until melted and smooth. Stir in the vanilla and a pinch of salt. Pour the mix into a parchment lined 8x8 inch squash baking pan. Cover and refrigerate overnight. .
Lift the chocolate out of the pan and cut into 16 squares. Insert a candy cane into the center of each. Place on a parchment lined baking sheet and transfer to the freeze. Freeze 20 minutes. .
Meanwhile, place the melted chocolate in a narrow drinking glass. Dip each square into the melted chocolate to coat. Remove and allow any excess chocolate to drip back into the bowl. Place on cookie sheet. Repeat with the remaining squares. if desired, add candies to the top of each square. Allow the chocolate to set in the fridge. Keep stored in the fridge until ready to use.
.
To make hot chocolate, stir 1 candy cane into 8-12 ounces of steaming milk. Top as desired. Drink up!

Your Saturday is about to be made that much better with a mug…or two, of this Minty Moscow Mule → or as I am calling it, Frosty’s Frosted Moscow Mule. Made extra minty and wintery with @mccormickspice peppermint along with plenty of vodka, lime, and gingerbeer.  Simple, quick, easy. So. Good. Recipe below.
.
.
2 ounces vodka
juice from 1/2 lime juice
1/4 cup fresh grapefruit juice
a dash of McCormick Peppermint Extract, to your taste
ginger beer, for topping
pomegranate arils and mint, for serving
.
Fill a cocktail glass with ice. Add the vodka, lime juice, grapefruit juice, and peppermint extract. Stir to combine. Top of with ginger beer. Garnish with pomegranate arils, a grapefruit slice, and fresh mint. DRINK.

Hey, hey melon lemonade margarita popsicles 🍉🍋 🍉 layers of fresh watermelon, sweet cantaloup, homemade lemonade, lime juice, and tequila. I mean, is there anything better on a hot summer day?! SO EASY and SO GOOD. Oh don't forget a squeeze of lime juice and sprinkle of flaky salt 😎
.
.
2 cups cubed watermelon
2 cups cubed cantaloupe
1 cup lemonade
1/2 cup lime juice
4-6 tablespoons tequila
.
.
Blend the watermelon, 1/2 the lemonade, 1/2 the lime juice, and 1/2 the tequila. Freeze in Popsicle molds until firm. Blend the cantaloupe and remaining ingredients. Freeze 1 hour. Insert Popsicle sticks. Freeze until firm. Sprinkle with salt. ENJOY. .
.

Mini Vegan No-Bake Chocolate Mocha Fudge Coconut Tarts...I made us dessert that’s basically health food. Like whoa, can I get a pat on the back or something, please? Just kidding...but, not really 🙃😉 these tarts are made up of coconut, cashews, dates, cacao, vanilla and coffee. super simple, but these really could not be any better. And trust me, vegan or not, you are going to love these 😋
.
ps. these are the perfect Saturday night, no guilt treat --> just saying.
.
*what you need for the crust*
3/4 cup roasted cashews
1/2 cup shredded unsweetened coconut
1 cup soft medjool dates pitted
1 vanilla bean seeds removed
1/4 cup cacao nibs
.
Blend everything together and press into a mini muffin tin lined with paper liners (DO THIS). Freeze.
.
*what you need to make the filling*
1 cup salted roasted cashews
1 cup canned coconut milk
1/2 cup coconut oil
1/2 cup unsweetened cocoa powder or cacao powder
8 whole medjool dates pits removed
2 tablespoons vanilla extract
3 teaspoons instant coffee powder
.
Blend until creamy and fill the tart shells. Freeze 20 minutes or place in the fridge until ready eat. To remove, just lift the wax paper up and the tarts should pop right out. enjoy...😍

How to make your morning bowl of oats a little more exciting? For one, use milk and not water. This bowl of earl grey blueberry oatmeal is probably one of my favorite quick, easy, and healthy breakfast. Nothing can beat it's warm and cozy flavors. Top with a little cinnamon, banana, hemp seeds, and a good drizzle of honey for added sweetness and you have the perfect bowl. 😉 .

Bonfire Brownies...from The Half Baked Harvest Cookbook 🤗 the cookbook is out in t-minus 12 days and that means it's time for a sneak peak inside --> here’s how these brownies break down by layer: graham cracker, fudge brownie studded with salty pretzels, choco­late squares, and toasted marshmallow. <–aka the bonfire brownie. yummmmm 😋 ps. the ending clip is the BEST 🍫
.
.
4-5 whole graham cracker sheets
½ cup (1 stick) unsalted butter
2 ounces milk (or semi sweet) chocolate, chopped
¾ cup granulated sugar
1 ½ teaspoons pure vanilla extract
1 tablespoon high-quality instant coffee granules
1 tablespoon Kahlúa (optional)
2 large eggs
½ cup unsweetened cocoa powder
½ cup all-purpose flour
¼ teaspoon kosher salt
¼ cup smoked almonds, chopped
½ cup mini pretzel twists
1-2 (1.5-ounce) chocolate bars
2 cups large square marshmallows
.
.
Arrange the graham crackers in a single layer in the bottom of a 9-inch square baking dish lined with parchment paper.
.
Microwave the butter and milk chocolate until melted and smooth. Add the sugar, vanilla, coffee, Kahlúa, and eggs and whisk until smooth. Stir in the cocoa powder, flour, and salt until smooth and just combined. Fold in the almonds. Pour the batter over the graham crackers. Gently press the pretzels on top.
.
Bake at 350 for 25 to 30 minutes, until the brownies are set on top. Remove from the oven and immediately add the chocolate bar pieces to the top of the brownies. Add the marshmallows over the chocolate and then return the brownies to the oven. After 5 minutes, turn on the broiler. Broil the brownies for 15 to 30 seconds, or until the tops of the marshmallow are just golden—WATCH CLOSE! Remove from the oven and let the brownies cool in the pan for about 30 minutes...right 😉 Cut into squares and DEVOUR. .
.

Caramelized Peach + White Chocolate Oatmeal Skillet Cookie Pie 😍😍 Caramelized peaches on the bottom, oatmeal skillet cookie on top...studded with white chocolate chips --> the most perfect dessert for these late summer days. Bring on the weekend, fresh peaches, and skillet cookie pies 👊
.
*for the caramelized peaches*
2 tablespoons butter
4-5 medium peaches or nectarines or a mix of both
1/3 cup brown sugar
*for the cookie topping*
1 3/4 cups old fashioned oatmeal
1 1/2 cups white whole wheat flour
3/4 teaspoon baking soda
1/4 teaspoon salt
1 cup brown sugar
3/4 cup melted coconut oil
2 eggs
2 teaspoons vanilla extract
1 cup white chocolate chips
.
Heat an ovenproof skillet over medium heat. Add 1 tablespoon of the butter. Add the peaches and sprinkle with 1/3 cup brown sugar. Cook 3 minutes; stir peaches, and cook another 2 to 3 minutes or until caramelized.
.
In a large mixing bowl stir together all the topping ingredients until combine. Fold in the white chocolate.
.
Sprinkle the cookie dough over the peaches. Bake in 350 degree oven for about 20-25 minutes. Top with vanilla ice cream. Enjoy!
.

Cheesy Buffalo Chicken Stuffed Bread...who’s ready for the most un-fancy meal ever!? Game Day ready with this recipe 🏈
.
1 loaf soft French or ciabatta bread
olive oil, for drizzling
kosher salt + pepper
1 clove garlic
8 ounces cream cheese, at room temperature
1/4 cup ranch dressing, homemade or store-bought
1/2 cup buffalo sauce + more for serving
1/2 teaspoon smoked paprika
1 1/2 -2 cups shredded chicken
1 1/2 cups shredded cheddar cheese
1/2 cup crumbled blue cheese
.
Slice the top 1/3 of the bread off. Rub the insides with olive oil and sprinkle with garlic, salt + pepper. Bake in a 350 degree oven for 8-10 minutes.
.
Mix together the cream cheese, ranch, buffalo sauce, and paprika. Stir in the chicken, half the cheddar, and blue cheese. Gently spread the filling over the bread. Top with the remaining cheddar cheese and then the top piece of the bread. Bake for 20-25 minutes or until the cheese has melted. .
Serve with more buffalo sauce and ranch if desired. DIG IN. .
.

Bulgogi BBQ Chicken Tacos with Mango Slaw...and things because I clearly love a loaded taco! Guys. I never get around to posting tacos on taco Tuesday, but today is the day and I could not be more exited because these are my favorite. You need them in your life. Like now. Tonight. Tomorrow. Just make it soon. <--trust me, these are the BEST. 😉
.
In a large bowl, combine 1 cup low sodium soy sauce, 1/2 cup mirin, 1/4 cup brown sugar, 1 tablespoon Gochujang (Korean chile paste), 1 tablespoon fresh grated ginger, 4 cloves chopped garlic, and 2 tablespoons sesame oil. Add 2 pounds sliced chicken or pork and toss well to coat. Cover and place in the fridge for 1 hour or overnight.
.
To make the slaw. Add 2 cups cabbage, 1 sliced mango and 2 chopped charred jalapeño or fresno peppers, and 1/3 cup chopped cilantro to a bowl. Toss with 1 tablespoon low sodium soy sauce, 2 teaspoons rice vinegar and 2 teaspoons sesame oil. .
Cook the chicken in hot skillet until caramelized, spooning the marinade over the chicken as it cooks.
.
To assemble, add the chicken to a warmed, charred tortilla. Top with slaw, cheese and sesame seeds. EAT.
.

SNICKERDOODLE Chocolate CHEX MIX Bars!! Kind of excited about these. I like to call them "idiot proof" because they are just that easy and honestly just about anyone can make them. PLUS, they are SO GOOD. I mean, what is better then Chex Mix + snickerdoodle + chocolate?!?! Perfect for holiday desserts and holiday gifting! Yup, yup! Full recipe below! .
.
2 cups Corn Chex
1 cup Rice Chex
1 cup Whole Wheat Chex
1 1/2 cups bite size pretzels
1 cup air popped popcorn
1 cup mixed nuts
1/4 cup salted butter, melted
1 teaspoon cinnamon
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
1 cup creamy peanut butter
1 cup honey
1 cup brown sugar
2-3 cups semi-sweet chocolate chips, melted
.
.
Combine the cereals, pretzels, popcorn, and nuts in a large bowl. Stir together the butter, cinnamon, and vanilla. Toss with the Chex Mix. Melt together the peanut butter, honey, and brown sugar. Pour over the Chex Mix and toss well. Press the mix into muffin cups or a baking pan. Pour over the melted chocolate. Chill until firm. Sprinkle with flaky salt...EAT!
.
.

butter

.

Champagne Fettuccine...because it's the holidays and even our pasta should be fancy. Obviously. ..
.
4 tablespoons unsalted butter
2 cloves garlic, minced or grated
4 sage leaves, chopped
4 ounces cream cheese, at room temperature  Coupons
2 cups heavy cream (or 1 cup milk, 1 cup cream)
1 1/2 cups champagne
1 cup freshly grated parmesan cheese
1/2 cup gorgonzola cheese (optional)
pinch of freshly grated nutmeg
1 pound cooked fettuccine
fresh parsley for topping
.
.
Melt the butter in a large skillet with high sides over medium-high heat. Add the garlic and sage. Cook for 3-5 minutes or until the garlic is fragrant and the sage crispy. Stir in the cream (and milk if using) and cream cheese. Bring to a boil and simmer until smooth and creamy, about 5 minutes. Add the champagne, gorgonzola, crushed red pepper, nutmeg and a good pinch of pepper, whisk until the cheese has fully melted and the sauce thickened.Stir the pasta and season with salt and pepper.
Plate the pasta.Sprinkle with parsley and parmesan. .
.

Pumpkin + Snickerdoodle + Chai Spice Sugar = Pumpkin Chai Snickerdoodles. Sweet, chewy, soft, cinnamony, and all things delicious...and cozy. AKA the perfect cookie to make tonight, tomorrow, or next week for Thanksgiving. Also? These are best enjoyed with a steaming cup of chai tea. Obviously. Full recipe below. .
2 cups all-purpose
1/2 teaspoon baking soda
1/2 teaspoon cream of tarter
1/2 teaspoon kosher salt
1/4 teaspoon nutmeg
1 stick butter, at room temp
1 cup granulated sugar
1/2 cup pumpkin puree
1 egg
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
.
Combine the dry ingredients in a bowl. Using an electric mixer, beat together the butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Add the pumpkin, egg, and vanilla and beat until combined. Gradually add the dry ingredients, mixing until just fully combined.
.
Make the Chai Spice sugar: combine 1/3 cup granulates sugar, 2 teaspoons cinnamon, 1/2 teaspoon ginger, 1/2 teaspoon all-spice, 1/2 teaspoon cardamom, 1/4 teaspoon ground cloves, and a pinch of black pepper (of your want) in a medium bowl. .
Roll the dough into 1 tablespoon size balls and then generously roll through the chai sugar. Place on a parchment lined baking sheet, spacing the cookies 2 inches apart. Bake in a 375 degree oven for 8-11 minutes or until the cookies are just starting to set around the edges. Do not over bake, always under bake. If desired, you can brush the cookies with a little melted butter and sprinkle with the remaining chai sugar...which you should definitely do and then EAT. Immediately 😉

All around amily favorite meal right here: 30 Minute Healthy Kickin’ Cajun Chicken and Rice. One skillet, under 30 minutes and served with a giant bowl of rice...aka the perfect Gerard family meal. 👌
.
.
1 pound chicken, cut into bite size pieces
2 tablespoons olive oil
1 tablespoon cajun seasoning
1 tablespoon creole seasoning
1 teaspoon sweet paprika
1 teaspoon pepper
1/2 teaspoon cayenne
1/2 teaspoon dried thyme
2 tablespoons soy sauce
1 red pepper and green chopped
1/2 a sweet onion chopped
2 cloves garlic minced or grated
1 (14 ounce) can diced tomatoes
rice and parsley, for serving
.
.
In a small bowl combine the cajun seasoning, creole seasoning, pepper, cayenne, sweet paprika, and dried thyme.
.
Heat a large skillet over medium high heat and drizzle with olive oil.Add the chicken and the spice mixture to the skillet and give it a good toss. Cook, without stirring for 2-4 minutes. Then stir the chicken and add the soy sauce, continue cooking another 5 minutes or until the chicken is browned all over and cooked through. Remove the chicken from the skillet.
.
Add a little olive oil. Add the peppers, onion, and garlic. Stir fry the veggies for about 5-10 minutes or until the onions are soft. Add the chicken back to the skillet. Stir in the tomatoes and simmer until almost all the liquid has evaporated. .
Serve the chicken over rice and top with fresh parsley. Enjoy!

Cranberry Pot Roast --> guys, don’t be freaked. I promise, this combo isn’t weird, just good. Really good! Make this one on a cold day when you need an easy dinner the family will love. It's a classic, but with a twist. Full recipe below! .
1 (4-5) pound chuck roast
kosher salt and pepper
2 tablespoons extra olive oil
1 onion, quartered
6 inch carrots, cut into 1- pieces
1 cup red wine
2-3 cups low-sodium beef broth
8 ounces cremini mushrooms, sliced
2 tablespoons worcestershire sauce
2 tablespoons balsamic vinegar
3 sprigs fresh thyme
1 sprig fresh rosemary
12 ounces fresh cranberries
2 tablespoons honey
.
Preheat the oven to 275 degrees F. Season the chuck roast liberally with salt + pepper all over.
.
Heat olive oil in a large dutch oven, over high heat. Add the onion and carrots and cook, stirring once or twice until the veggies are just slightly browned on the edges, about 5 minutes. Remove the veggies to a plate. Add another drizzle of oil and add the chuck roast and sear all over, about 3-4 minutes per side. Add the wine and then cover with 2-3 cups of beef broth, the worcestershire sauce, and balsamic. Throw in the mushrooms + browned veggies, thyme, rosemary, cranberries + honey. .
Cover the pan and place in the oven. Roast for 3-4 hours or until the roast is cooked to your liking. Serve over mashed potatoes or eggs noodles.
.

Homemade Cheddar Pierogi. What’s not to love of about a pillowy cheese filled dumpling with a little butter drizzled overtop, you know? The BEST. Make these this weekend. Trust me, your family will love you for it. Recipe below. .
.
2 cups all-purpose flour
1 teaspoon kosher salt
2 tablespoons butter, melted
1 cup plain full fat greek yogurt
1 egg
.
4 russet potatoes, peeled and quartered
2 cups shredded sharp cheddar cheese
2 tablespoons butter, at room temperature
1/2 teaspoon onion powder
melted butter or rosemary butter
.
To make the dough. In a medium bowl, combine the flour, salt, butter, yogurt, and egg, and mix until combined. Knead the dough for 2-3 minutes. Cover and let sit 30 minutes.
.
To make the filling. In a large pot of cold water, bring the potatoes to a boil. Salt the water and cook until the potatoes are tender, about 20 to 30 minutes. Drain the potatoes, return the potatoes to the pot and mash with the butter and cheddar. Season to taste with salt and pepper. .
Roll the dough out onto a floured surface and cut out 3-inch circles. Spoon 2 teaspoons of filling into the center of each round. Brush the edges with water and fold half of the dough over the filling to enclose it. Press down the edges to seal, pressing out all the air.
.
Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Boil the Pierogi in batches for 1-2 minutes, or until they float. Drain. Divide the Pierogi among plates.Top with cheddar. EAT!

Crispy Cheesy Potatoes Stacks. Best potatoes ever right here. Enough Said. Full recipe below. .
4 medium potatoes, cut into 1/8 inch thick slices
1/4 cup chopped fresh oregano
2 tablespoons chopped fresh thyme
1 stick butter, melted
kosher salt and pepper
1/2 cup grated Asiago cheese
1/2 cup shredded sharp cheddar
.
Preheat the oven 400 degrees F. Lightly grease a 12 cup muffin tin.
.
Cut the potatoes using a mandoline. Toss together the potatoes, oregano, thyme, butter, salt and pepper. Add the cheese and toss again. Layer the potatoes evenly among the prepared muffin tin, stacking the layers all the way to the top. .
Cover with foil and place on a baking sheet. Transfer to the oven and roast for 30 minutes. Remove the foil and continue cooking another 20-25 minutes or until the potatoes are tender and golden. Eat immediately, sprinkled with a little sea salt.

Sweet and Savory Cheesy Bacon Wrapped Puff Pastry Twist --> Umm? Do I need to say more? These are the perfect holiday appetizer. They are pretty, easy, and everybody loves them. Enough said. Full recipe below. Watch the vid and bring on the Thanksgiving all appetizers.
.
2 sheets frozen puff pastry, thawed
1 egg, beaten
1-2 teaspoons cayenne pepper (optional)
1 cup shredded cheddar cheese
26-30 pieces thin cut bacon
1/2 cup brown sugar
1 tablespoon chopped fresh rosemary
Kosher salt + pepper
.
Open one sheet of puff pastry and rush the surface lightly with beaten egg. Sprinkle with cayenne and cheese.
Dust a rolling pin lightly with flour and then roll over the cheese to gently press the cheese into the puff pastry.
.
Cut the pastry into long, 1/2-inch-wide strips. Take each strip, fold in half and pinch the ends together. Gently twist each strip several times. Wrap the bacon around the twist. .
Combine the sugar, rosemary, salt and pepper in a bowl. Dip the twist through the sugar. Place on a baking sheet and bake in a 375 degree oven for 30 to 40 minutes, rotating the pans halfway through. EAT!!
.

Cauliflower Crust “Pizza” with Chickpea “Pepperoni”...because on Monday we still need PIZZA and CHEESE. Obviously. 👊🍕
.
For the Cauliflower Crust
1 medium size head of cauliflower, roughly chopped
1/2 cup goat cheese
1/4 cup grated parmesan cheese
1 egg
.
For the Chickpea "Pepperoni"
1 (14 ounce) can chickpeas, drained + rinsed
2 tablespoons olive oil
2 teaspoons smoked paprika
1-2 teaspoons crushed red peper flakes
1 teaspoon fennel seeds
1 teaspoon mustard seeds
1 teaspoon onion powder
1/2 teaspoon salt
.
What you need for topping
1 cup of your favorite tomato sauce
8 ounces buffalo mozzarella, sliced (or regular mozzarella)
pinch of crushed red pepper flakes
parmesan and basil, serving
.
Add the cauliflower to a food processor and pulse until it resembles rice. Dump the cauliflower out onto a towel and ring out as much water as possible. Add to a large bowl. Add the goat cheese, parmesan cheese, egg and a pinch of salt. Mix until evenly combined. Dump the mixture out onto a parchment lined baking sheet and press into a 1/4 inch thick crust. Bake at 400 for 30-40 minutes or until the top is dry and golden yellow. .
Make the chickpeas. Add all of the ingredients to a skillet and toss to combine. Cook 5 minutes until the chickpeas are crisp.
.
Spread the crust with pizza sauce and top with mozzarella, crushed red pepper flakes and chickpeas. Bake for 10 minutes or until the cheese is melted. Top with basil, arugula and parmesan. Enjoy!
.
.

The 4+ feet of snow outside have me literally freezing and the only thing I can think about is SOUP. This Salsa Verde Chicken and Rice Tortilla Soup is my all time favorite winter soup. It is cozy, healthy and all made in ONE POT. Yes. Loaded with chicken, brown rice, and salsa verde and topped with just about everything imaginable (cheese, fried tortillas, avocado, more cheese, cilantro, etc.)...aka the only way to do soup. .
.
2 teaspoons chili powder
2 teaspoons cumin
1 teaspoon Mexican oregano
1 teaspoon smoked paprika
1 tablespoon brown sugar
salt + pepper, to taste
2 tablespoons olive oil
1 pound boneless skinless chicken thighs or breast
2 cups homemade or store bought salsa verde
4 cups low sodium chicken broth
2 cup broccoli rabe or kale, chopped
2 cups cooked white or brown rice OR quinoa*
1/2 cup fresh cilantro, chopped
juice of 1 lime
avocado, plain greek yogurt, cilantro, cheddar+ green onions, for topping
.
.
In a small bowl, combine the chili powder, cumin, oregano, paprika, brown sugar and a large pinch of salt + pepper.
In a large heavy bottom soup pot, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Sprinkle half the seasoning mixture over the chicken. Once hot, sear the chicken until browned on about sides, about 3 minutes per side. Once the chicken is browned, lower the heat to LOW and slowly pour in the the chicken broth. Add the remaining spice mixture, salsa verde, broccoli rabe or kale and season the soup with salt + pepper. Cover and simmer 25 minutes or until the chicken is tender and cooked through.
Once the chicken is cooked though, shred with 2 forks. Remove the soup from the heat and stir in the rice + fresh cilantro + lime juice.
Divide the soup among bowl and top with avocado, a dollop of plain greek yogurt, fresh cilantro, green onion and cheese. Add a large hand full of the tortilla chips. EAT!
.
.

Super Easy Instant Pot (or Crockpot) Philly Cheesesteaks for the weekend. Not a classic cheesesteak, but SO GOOD. Also, this works really well with chicken too. Full recipe below! <--you have to try them. ps. these are perfect next weekend's Super Bowl. .
.
For the Meat
1-2 slice sweet onions thinly
2 teaspoons brown sugar
1 tablespoon worchestire sauce
2 tablespoons butter
2 pounds skirt steak, thinly sliced
1 teaspoon garlic power
kosher salt and pepper
8 ounces mushrooms, sliced
2 poblano peppers or green bell peppers, sliced
1 tablespoon low sodium soy sauce
2 1/2 - 3 cups beef broth
To Finish
1/3 cup fresh cilantro or parsley
4-6 hoagie rolls
6 slices provolone cheese
.
Add everything to the crockpot or instant pot. Cover and cook on meat/stew for 25 minutes (for crockpot cook on low for 6-8 hour ). Use the natural or quick release.
.
Shred steak. Stir in herbs. Assemble sammies. Generously top with provolone. Wrap in foil and place in the oven for 5 minutes. Serve warm, preferably with french fries (obviously). Enjoy!

Who said the healthiest recipes have to be salad? This Moroccan Lentil and Chickpea Soup is packed full of healthy ingredients, and YOU GUYS, it is, so, so good! Like it’s got to be in my top 10 soups, but then I love Moroccan flavors. They’re spicy, full of colorful veggies, and in this soups case, finished with a generous sprinkle of goat cheese. Perfect way to start the new year. Get the recipe below.
Ingredients:
1 1/2 cups green lentils
1 sweet onion, finely chopped
1 inch knob of fresh ginger, grated
2 cloves garlic, minced or grated
3 carrots, chopped
1 red bell pepper, chopped
1 (14 ounce) can diced tomatoes
4 cups low sodium veggie or chicken broth
1-2 tablespoons red harissa
2 teaspoons smoked paprika
3/4 teaspoon cumin
3/4 teaspoon cinnamon
kosher salt and pepper
1 tablespoon fresh lemon juice
1 (14 ounce) can chickpeas
1/2 cup fresh cilantro, chopped
crumbled goat cheese, for serving

Directions:
Combine everything but the lemon juice, chickpeas, and cilantro, in the slow cooker. Add 1/2 cup water. Cover and cook on low for 6-8 hours or on high for 4-6 hours. Before serving, stir in the lemon juice, chickpeas, and cilantro, cook until heated through. If the soup is thick, add more water or broth to thin. Taste and adjust the salt to your liking.

Ladle the soup into bowls and top with goat cheese. Eat!

Fudgy Avocado Brownies with Chocolate Fudge Frosting...um, yes I made us healthy brownies and they are honestly the BEST. You need them in your life this winter. <--trust me 😉
.
.
For the Brownies
2 ripe avocados, pitted + skins removed
3/4 cup coconut sugar
2 teaspoons instant coffee (optional)
2 teaspoons vanilla
2 ounces dark chocolate, melted
2 eggs
1/2 cup cacao or cocoa powder (I use cacao)
1/2 cup almond meal/flour
1/4 teaspoon salt
.
For the Frosting
1/3 cup real maple syrup
1/4 cup coconut oil
2 ounces dark chocolate, melted
1/3 cup cacao or cocoa powder
.
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line an 8x8 inch pan with parchment paper.
Add the avocado, coconut sugar, instant coffee and vanilla to a food processor and puree until completely smooth and no clumps of avocado remain. Pour in the melted chocolate and puree until smooth and combined. Add the eggs and process until the eggs are combined. Now add the cacao powder, almond meal and salt. Pulse until the mixture is just combined. Stir in the a little chopped chocolate if desired.
Evenly spread the mixture into the prepared baking pan. Bake for 30-35 minutes or until the brownies are just set. Allow to cool before frosting
.
To make the frosting. In a small sauce pan, melt together the maple syrup, coconut oil and dark chocolate over low heat until melted and smooth. Remove from the heat and stir in the cacao power + a pinch of salt. Pour the frosting over the brownies and spread in an even layer. Place the brownies in the fridge and allow the frosting to set 30 minutes to 1 hour. Cut in bars.
.

5 Ingredient Chocolate Dipped Peanut Butter Cookies. Quickly becoming the most popular cookie recipe on HBH...with good reason. These happen to be flourless, butterless, and contain no processed sugar. Meaning they’re basically health food, but still SO GOOD. Full recipe Below. MAKE THESE.
.
.
INGREDIENTS:
1 cup creamy peanut butter or almond butter
8 ounces pitted medjool dates ( 1 cup packed dates)
2 teaspoons vanilla extract
1 egg
8 ounces melted dark chocolate
.
DIRECTIONS:
Combine all ingredients in the bowl of a food processor. Roll the dough 14-15 balls and place on a parchment lined baking sheet. Using a fork, gently press down on each dough ball to flatten and create a cross hatch pattern. .
Transfer to the oven and bake at 350 for 9-10 minutes. It's important not to over bake these cookies, so set a timer!
.
Remove the cookies from the oven and let cool. To make dipping easier, freeze the cookies for 10-15 minutes. Then drizzle or dip the cookies in chocolate and sprinkle with peanuts. EAT. .
.
.

Blender Pancake Muffins 😍  because every Monday morning needs pancake muffins. Obviously. These muffins are my the BEST treat on busy weekday mornings. Make the batter in the blender, top with your favorite toppings (ummm....chocolate chips), bake, add butter, add maple. EAT. You can make a big batch on Sunday and then just warm them up in the morning. Perfection. Also? these are great for or a mid day snack too! 😉
.
*what you need*
2 1/2 cups white whole wheat flour or all-purpose flour
2 teaspoons baking powder
1/4 teaspoons cinnamon
1/2 teaspoon kosher salt
1 1/2 cups buttermilk
1/4 cup plain greek yogurt
2 eggs
2 tablespoons melted butter
2 teaspoons vanilla extract .
Blend all ingredients together until smooth and divide the batter between 12-16 muffin cups that you have greased (don't line with paper liners...they tend to stick).
.
Sprinkle on your desired toppings (have fun with them and make each muffin a little different with berries, chocolate chips, nuts, seeds, etc.). Bake in a 350 degree oven for 13-15 minutes. Serve warm with butter and maple. .

Salted Caramel Mocha + Nutella Brownies. Best. Brownies. EVER. What are you guys baking this Christmas? 🎄🎅
.
.
*Brownies*
2 sticks unsalted butter
4 ounces milk chocolate, chopped
1 1/2 cups granulated sugar
2 tablespoons instant coffee
1 tablespoon vanilla extract
2 tablespoons kahlua (optional, but not really!)
4 large eggs
1 cup unsweetened cocoa powder
1 cup all-purpose flour
1/4 teaspoon kosher salt
1/2 cup nutella
1 1/2 cups salted caramel sauce
.
.
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line an 9x13 inch baking dish with parchment paper.
Add the butter and milk chocolate to a medium size mixing bowl that is microwave safe. Microwave the butter and chocolate on 30 second intervals, stirring after each interval, until melted and smooth. To the melted chocolate mixture add the sugar and instant coffee, whisking until completely combined. Add the vanilla, Kahula, and eggs and whisk until smooth. Stir in the cocoa powder, flour and salt until smooth and just combined, try not to over mix the batter. Pour half the batter into the prepared pan. Dollop teaspoon size amounts of Nutella over the batter. Drizzle with three-fourths of the caramel. Spoon the remaining batter over top, using a spoon to lightly smooth out the batter. Bake for 25-30 minutes, until the brownies are set on top. Remove from the oven and allow to cool. Cut the brownies into bars and then drizzle the warmed caramel over the brownies. Sprinkle with salt. EAT!
.
.
Caramel Recipe HERE: http://www.halfbakedharvest.com/salted-caramel-mocha-nutella-brownies/
.
.

Cinnamon Grilled Peaches with mascarpone ice cream…and honey nut cheerio granola. 🍑😎🍑Really, do I need to explain any more? The ice cream melts over the warm and gooey peaches, and the granola provides a nice sweet crunch. It is possibly the most perfect summer dessert. Add a little extra sweetness with a drizzle of honey over the ice cream. It’s definitely not needed, but it’s SO GOOD. <—these are a must make this summer. 💯💯
.
.
*Granola*
2 cups Honey Nut Cheerios
1 cup rolled oats
1/2 cup peanuts or cashews
1/2 cup honey
3 tablespoons coconut oil or butter
2 teaspoons vanilla
.
*Peaches*
3-4 peaches nectarines, plums or apricots
2-4 tablespoons butter, melted
1/2 teaspoon cinnamon, or more to taste
.
.
Mix the ingredients for the granola on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Bake in a 350 F. oven for 15-20 minutes, tossing halfway through cooking. .
Preheat a grill or grill pan to high. Toss the stone fruit with butter and cinnamon. Grill the fruit for 2-3 minutes, flip and grill another 2-3 minutes. Serve the grilled fruit warm, with a large scoop of Vanilla Mascarpone Ice Cream (head to the bog for the recipe) and plenty of granola...then a drizzle of honey! 🙂
.
.
https://www.halfbakedharvest.com/cinnamon-grilled-peaches-mascarpone-ice-cream/
.
.

Happy December! Kicking off 25 Days of Christmas with these NUTELLA Christmas Cookie Pop-Tarts...with BROWNED BUTTER vanilla bean icing. Bring on all the Christmas treats!
.
.
Ingredients
2 rounds pie dough
1/2 cup nutella
buttermilk, for brushing

Icing
2 cups powdered sugar
2-3 tablespoons milk or water
4 tablespoon browned butter
1 teaspoon vanilla
assorted food coloring and holiday sprinkles, to decorate .
.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.

On a floured work surface, lay out your dough flat. Cut out the dough into your desired shapes, being sure to cut 2 of the same shapes to create pop-tarts. Spoon a tablespoon of nutella into the center of half of the shapes of dough. Top each with another dough sheet, and use a fork to crimp the edges together, sealing in the nutella. Place each pop-tart on the prepared baking sheet. Brush each pop tart with buttermilk. Transfer to the oven and bake for about 7-8 minutes or until golden brown.
Meanwhile, make the icing. combine the sugar, water, browned butter, and vanilla in a medium bowl. Mix until smooth and easy drizzled.
Frost the cooled pop-tarts and decorate as desired. .
.

Ending the weekend with my favorite Crockpot Spaghetti Squash Lasagna Bolognese. Possibly the easiest way to cook spaghetti squash and incredibly delicious. Bonus points that it’s a little healthier then a bowl of pasta too! Also? highly recommending throwing this in the crockpot for Halloween dinner. It would be the perfect for before or after trick-or-treating! <–do this 🎃 Full Recipe below. .
1 pound spicy Italian sausage or ground beef
1 pound lean ground beef (or Spicy Italian Sausage)
1 small sweet onion diced
2 cloves garlic minced or grated
kosher salt and pepper
1 (32 ounce) can peeled tomatoes
1/4 cup tomato paste
1 teaspoon dried oregano
1 bay leaf
1 cup whole milk
1 medium to large spaghetti squash, rinsed
8 ounces burrata or mozzarella cheese
grated Parmesan cheese for serving
.
Brown meat and onion in a large skillet. Season with salt and pepper. Add to the bowl of your crockpot with the garlic, tomatoes, tomato paste, oregano, bay leaves, and milk. Stir to combine.
Poke the spaghetti squash with a fork. Add the squash to the center of the sauce. Cover and cook on low for 6-8 hours.
.
Carefully remove the squash from the crockpot and transfer to a cutting board. Remove the seeds, then using a fork, scrape the squash into strands. .
Divide the squash among bowls and ladle the bolognese over top. Add the cheese. EAT.
.

Blackberry Bourbon Smash --> the only way to properly welcome the weekend 💣 fresh summer blackberries (my favorite), a little mint, lemon, honey, and a good amount of bourbon. simple. easy. the BEST. ps. I am realizing this is the last weekend of July?! 😲 blackberry filled bourbon smashes are a must 😋
.
*here is what you need*
granulated sugar - for the rim of the glasses
zest from 1 lime - again for the rims
8 fresh blackberries
7 leaves mint
juice from half a lemon
1-2 tablespoons honey
2 ounces bourbon (or ya know, a little more)
ginger beer for topping
.
rim glasses in sugar and lime zest.
.
muddle the blackberries, mint, lemon juice, and honey together, squishing everything to release the juices. Add the bourbon.
.
add ice to your rimmed glass and pour the drink over the ice. Top with a little more ice and then ginger beer. DRINK! 🙂
.
.

3-Ingredient Blue Cheese Appetizer...the idiot proof appetizer for the holidays. Enough said. Merry Christmas Eve! 🎄 🎅  recipe below👇 .
.
1 (12 ounce) can Biscuits
1 stick salted butter
4 ounces blue cheese crumbled (can use feta cheese)
.
.
Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F.
Melt the butter in a 9 inch pie plate.
Cut each biscuit into quarters and place in the pie plate with the butter and toss to combine. Sprinkle the cheese over the biscuits. Bake for 30-35 minutes or until the top is lightly browned and bubbly. EAT!

As if French Onion Soup couldn’t get any better...I had to go and add gnocchi. Yes. Gnocchi! And you guys, it’s just about as amazing as it sounds. Think about it – pillow soft gnocchi, floating about in your onion soup, topped off with gruyere cheese? It’s basically heaven in a bowl. Grab the full recipe below. Happiest November!
.
6 tablespoons butter, cubed
4 sweet onions, thinly sliced
2 cloves garlic, minced or grated
1 tablespoon brown sugar
3 tablespoons all-purpose flour
1 1/2 cups red wine
2 quarts beef broth
1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce
2 leaves bay
3-4 fresh thyme sprigs
pinch of pepper
16 ounces potato gnocchi
1 1/2 cups shredded gruyere cheese
.
Melt the butter in a large pot over medium-high heat. Add the onions, garlic and brown sugar and cook about 15-25 minutes until the onions are deep golden in color and caramelized.
.
Reduce the heat, sprinkle the flour over the onions, stirring the flour into the onions. Cook for 5 minutes. Add the wine, beef broth, Worcestershire, bay leaves, and thyme. Bring to a boil. Stir in the gnocchi and cook until the gnocchi floats, 5 minutes. Remove the thyme sprigs and bay leaves from the soup. Season, to taste with salt and pepper.
.
Ladle the soup into oven safe bowls and top evenly with cheese. Broil until bubbly and golden brown. Eat!
.

Instant Pot Spicy Pineapple Chicken Tacos. OMG. these my favorite and apparently yours too since they have quickly become one of the most popular recipes on HBH. Why? because they are easy, healthy, and SO GOOD. Throw everything in the instant pot (or crockpot) and DONE. Nothing better. Full recipe is below. Enjoy!

For the Tacos:
2 pounds boneless skinless chicken breasts
1/2 sweet onion, diced
2 cloves garlic, minced or grated
2 teaspoons chili powder
1 teaspoon paprika
1/2 teaspoon cumin
1 teaspoon kosher salt
1-2 chipotle chile peppers in adobo, chopped
1/2 cup pineapple juice
1 cup fresh pineapple chunks
1 poblano pepper, sliced

Combine all ingredients in your instant pot (or crockpot). Cover and cook on high pressure/manual for 10-15 minutes (or 4 hours on high in the crockpot). Once done cooking, use the quick release function and release the steam. Shred the chicken using two forks.
To make the salsa, in a bowl, combine 1 cup fresh pineapple chunks, 1 jalapeño, 1/4 cup cilantro, juice from 1 lime, and a pinch of salt.

Stuff the chicken into warmed taco shells and top with pineapple salsa, cheese, and avocado. Enjoy!

Sheet Pan Poblano Chicken Fajitas. These fajitas are one of those recipes that are likely to become a weekly thing. They’re so simple, so fast and so amazingly good! One pan, healthy ingredients…almost all pantry staples…and ready in about 30 minutes. Basically your dream weeknight dinner, especially when accompanied with a large side of chips and guacamole…and maybe a margarita too! <–yes, yes, let’s. Grab the recipe below. .
.
1 1/2 pounds boneless chicken breasts, cut into strips
1 tablespoon chili powder
1 teaspoon cumin
1 teaspoon smoked paprika
1 teaspoon garlic powder
1 teaspoon kosher salt and pepper
3 tablespoons olive oil
1 orange and (1) red bell pepper, sliced
1 poblano pepper, sliced
1 sweet onion, thinly sliced
juice of 1 lime, plus more for serving
1/4 cup fresh cilantro, chopped
8-10 warmed tortillas
2 cups steamed rice, for serving
shredded cheddar, sliced avocado and salsa, for serving
.
.
On a large baking sheet, toss together the chicken, seasonings, salt, pepper, and a drizzle of olive oil. To the opposite side of the pan, add the veggies and a drizzle of olive oil. Season with salt and pepper and toss to combine. Bake at 425 for 25 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through.
.
Remove from the the oven and toss everything together with the lime juice and cilantro. .
To serve, divide the rice among warmed tortillas. Top with chicken, peppers, cheese, avocado, and salsa. Enjoy! .
.

Making holiday entertaining much easier (and tastier) with these Crisp Prosciutto and Baked Brie Pretzels. Three simple ingredients all found at @walmart, just 15 minutes to make, and possibly the best, cheesy holiday appetizer you can make. Pretzels + Brie + Crispy Prosciutto --> really not sure there is a better salty and cheesy combo. Be sure to top these with a few pomegranate seeds for a festive touch and if you want to add a little sweetness, a drizzle of honey just before serving would be pretty good. Full recipe below.
.
12 Olde Thyme Pretzel Twist
1 (8 ounce) wheel Brie, cut into 12 wedges
6 slices prosciutto, torn in half
pomegranate seeds, for topping
.
Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. Arrange the pretzels on a parchment lined baking sheet. To each pretzels, add a wedge of Brie and a half slice of prosciutto. Transfer to the oven and bake 10-15 minutes or until the prosciutto is crisp. Serve warm, garnished with pomegranate arils. Enjoy!

Overnight Gingerbread Cinnamon Rolls --> these cinnamon rolls are some of the BEST ever (thanks to @landolakesktchn Land O Lakes® Butter for keeping the dough incredibly moist). I am not sure there is a more delicious December breakfast. Perfect for Christmas morning...or just a fancy midweek breakfast. Grab the full recipe below.
.
For The Dough
2 1/4 teaspoons active dry yeast
1 tablespoon brown sugar
3/4 cup warm whole milk
4 tablespoons Land O Lakes® Butter, melted
1 egg
1/3 cup molasses
3 cups all-purpose flour
1/2 teaspoon kosher salt
.
Place the yeast and brown sugar into a stand mixer with the dough hook attached. Add the warm milk and gently stir. Let sit until it is puffed and foamy on top, about 10 minutes. Add the remaining ingredients to the bowl and knead the dough until it is smooth and forms a ball, 5 minutes. Cover with plastic wrap and let rise in a warm area until doubled in size, about 1 hour.
.
Make the filling. Add 1/4 cup sugar,1/4 cup brown sugar, 2 teaspoons cinnamon, 1 teaspoon ginger, and 1/4 teaspoon nutmeg to bowl.
.
Roll the dough into a rectangle (about 9×24 inches). Spread the butter evenly over the dough. Sprinkle the cinnamon/ginger sugar. Roll the dough into a log, keeping it fairly tight as you go. Cut into 10-12 rolls. Place rolls in the prepared baking dish. Cover with plastic wrap and transfer to the fridge to rise overnight. In the morning, remove the rolls from the fridge. Preheat oven to 350. Bake for 25 minutes.
.
In a bowl, beat together the 4 ounces cream cheese and 4 tablespoons butter until fluffy. Beat in 1 cup powdered sugar and 2 teaspoons vanilla. Spread the frosting on warm rolls. EAT!

20 Minute Heirloom Tomato Basil Chicken Parmesan Bolognese --> tomatoes, basil, chicken, parmesan, mozzarella…more basil. Pasta. 20 minute dinner perfection 👊
.
extra virgin olive oil
1 pound ground chicken or turkey
2 cloves garlic, minced or grated
1 tomato, finely chopped
1 cup cherry tomatoes, halved
1/3 cup red wine...or a little more 😉
2 tablespoons balsamic vinegar
1 teaspoon red pepper flakes
kosher salt + pepper
1 cup fresh basil
parmesan + mozzarella
1 pound spaghetti
.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet and cook the chicken until browned all over. Season with salt and pepper. Add the garlic, tomatoes. 2 tablespoons olive oil, red wine, balsamic vinegar, and 1/2 cup of water. Bring the sauce to a simmer and cook 10 minutes or until the sauce has thickened just slightly. Season to taste with salt, pepper and crushed red pepper.
.
Remove the bolognese from the heat and stir in the basil
and parmesan. Arrange mozzarella overtop. Transfer to the oven and broil 1-2 minutes until cheese is melted. Serve sauce overtop a generous bowl of spaghetti. .

Warm Chocolate Chip Cookie Stuffed Soft Pretzels. Valentine's Day has nothing on these...
.
.
what you need 🍪❤
1 cup (2 sticks) salted butter, softened
1/2 cup granulated sugar
1 cup packed brown sugar
3 teaspoon vanilla extract
2 eggs
2 1/2 cups all-purpose flour
1 teaspoon baking soda
1/2 teaspoon salt
2 cups semi-sweet chocolate chips
1 batch pretzel dough
1 egg, beaten
.
Beat the butter, sugar, brown sugar and vanilla in large bowl until creamy. Add the eggs and beat well. Gradually beat in the flour, baking soda and salt. Stir in the chocolate chips.
Divide the pretzel dough into 8 equal balls and roll out into a rectangle. Spread a little cookie dough along the length of each piece. Starting with the opposite side, roll the dough up into a log, enclosing the toppings inside. Pinch the seams together and then very gently roll the dough with your hands to form an even cylinder and fully enclose the filling.
Take the two ends of each rope and form into a circle that is overlapped by a couple of inches of dough on either side, twist the ends and lay over the opposite side to form a pretzel shape. Press the ends under the pretzel to seal.
Grab a bowl and fill it with warm water and 2 teaspoons baking soda. Dunk each pretzel in water and then place on a parchment lined baking sheet. Brush the tops with the egg wash and season liberally with sea salt. Bake at 425 for 15 to 18 minutes or until pretzels are very lightly golden and the cookies that have oozed out are golden. You do not want to over cook the pretzels. Eat warm...with milk. Obviously. .
.

Sweet and Savory Cheesy Bacon Wrapped Puff Pastry Twist...aka the most perfect holiday appetizer there ever was. Full recipe below. Watch the vid and bring on the Thanksgiving appetizers 👇
.
.
2 sheets frozen puff pastry, thawed
1 egg, beaten
1-2 teaspoons cayenne pepper (optional)
1 cup shredded cheddar cheese
26-30 pieces thin cut bacon
1/2 cup brown sugar
1 tablespoon chopped fresh rosemary
Kosher salt + pepper
.
.
Preheat oven to 375 degree F.
Open one sheet of puff pastry on a cutting board. Brush the surface lightly with some of the beaten egg. Sprinkle with cayenne  and cheese.
Dust a rolling pin lightly with flour and then roll over the cheese to gently press the cheese into the puff pastry.

Cut the puff pastry into long 1/2-inch-wide strips and then take each strip, fold in half and pinch the ends together. Gently twist each strip several times. Wrap the bacon around the twist.
Combine the sugar, rosemary, salt and pepper in a bowl. Dip the twist through the sugar, using your hands to coat all over the twist. Place on the baking sheet and transfer to the oven and bake for 30 to 40 minutes, rotating the pans halfway through. EAT!!
.
.

Mozzarella in Carrozza (...so a fried mozzarella sandwich) with Blueberry Balsamic Jam --> aka fresh mozzarella + basil sandwiched between bread that has been dipped in egg, coated in parmesan and pan fried 😍 Two words: SO GOOD. This is like a grilled cheese, but elevated. Trust me, you need to make this because it’s the simple things in life that are the best 👊
.
*what you need*
4 slices sourdough bread
4-6 ounces fresh mozzarella
8 slices fresh basil leaves
1 cup of milk
1 1/2 cups flour
1/2 cup grated parmesan cheese
4 eggs
blueberry balsamic jam (recipe on the blog)
.
Sandwich together the bread, mozzarella, and basil. Add the milk, flour + parmesan, and eggs to three separate shallow bowls.
.
Add a little olive oil to a large skillet.
.
Working in a line (milk, flour eggs), dredge both sides of the sandwich through the milk. From the milk move to the flour/parmesan mixture. Now move to the eggs. Fry 1 sandwich in at a time until the cheese is melted and the crust is golden.
.
Slice in half, sprinkle with fresh basil and drizzle with blueberry jam. EAT 😋

Say hi to your new favorite salad of summer, farro tabbouleh with burrata and hummus. Homemade farro tabbouleh, loaded with veggies, sitting atop a bed of hummus and finished with BURRATA. 😍 Important tip from me to you, pita chips should replace your eating utensils for this salad. Just telling it like it is⚡️
.
.
1 cup Farro
1 zucchini
1 1/2 cups cherry tomatoes
1 cup fresh blueberries
2 Persian cucumbers
1 cup fresh parsley
1/2 cup fresh basil
1/4 cup fresh mint
1/4 cup fresh lemon juice
1/4 cup roasted pistachios + sunflower seeds
1/4 cup olive oil
1 garlic clove
flakey sea salt and pepper
hummus + burrata cheese
.
cook the farro and grill the zucchini.
.
add the farro to a bowl with the remaining ingredients and toss well to combine. Taste, and season with salt and pepper.
.
spread the hummus in and even layer in a bowl. Top with the farro mix. Add the burrata...dig in with pitta chips. .
.
.

It’s finally the time I wait for all year long. CHRISTMAS season! Today I am kicking things off with some crazy easy, holiday potpourri that simmers on the stove all day long. This is my favorite thing to have simmering on the stove all December long! You have to try it...so, let’s make the house smell like Christmas! 🎄
.
.
1 1/2 cups fresh cranberries
3 tangerines, halved
3 whole cinnamon sticks
2 star anise (optional)
1 teaspoon whole cloves
1 inch piece fresh ginger
1 vanilla bean + 1 tablespoon vanilla extract
1 small branch fresh pine
1 cup apple cider, pomegranate or cranberry juice
.
.
Combine all the ingredients in a medium size sauce pot. Fill the pot with water until it reaches 3/4 the way full. Place the pot on the stove and bring to a gentle boil. Reduce the heat to a simmer, adding more water as needed. I let mine simmer for close to 4 hours and then let it cool over night and simmer again the next day. Just be sure to keep adding more water.
.

5 Ingredient Crockpot Chocolate Bars...yes, crockpot chocolate bars. It's a thing and it's delicious. With Halloween tomorrow, and Thanksgiving and Christmas quickly approaching (so excited), I really couldn’t think of a better dessert to share with you guys. These are the perfect holiday treat and make a pretty awesome homemade gift too. Plus, they are easy and so good. Grab the full recipe below. .
2 cups raw pumpkin seeds or roasted pumpkin seeds
2 cups lightly crushed pretzels
5 cups semi-sweet chocolate chips
1 1/2 cups butterscotch chips
3/4 cup creamy peanut butter
.
In this order, add the pumpkin seeds, pretzels, chocolate chips, and butterscotch chips to the bottom of your crockpot. Dollop the peanut butter over top. Cover and cook on low for 3 hours, do not stir during coking.
.
Line a jelly roll pan or 9x13 inch baking dish with parchment paper. After 2 1/2-3 hours, stir everything together until there are no streaks. Spoon the candy out into the prepared pan and spread in an even layer. Chill in the fridge until firm. Cut into bars. Enjoy!
.

Friday night pasta --> Avocado Zucchini Carbonara Pasta. Creamy avocado based sauce, crisp bacon, plenty of parmesan, and fresh pasta. Nothing better on a Friday night 👊 Also? Carbs. Cheese. Avocado. <–literally my favorites 😋 got to love Fridays! .
1 pound bucatini pasta
2 ripe, small to medium avocado, halved
1 egg
1/4 cup fresh basil, plus more for serving
kosher salt and pepper
6 slices thick cut bacon, chopped
2 small zucchini, cut into ribbons
2 tablespoons chopped fresh thyme or oregano
1 teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes, or to taste
1 cup grated parmesan cheese, plus more for serving
.
Cook the pasta according to package directions until al dente. Just before draining, remove 1 cup of the pasta cooking water. Drain the pasta.
.
Blend together the avocado, egg, basil, and a pinch each of salt and pepper. With the blender running, stream in about 1/2 cup of the pasta cooking water. .
Cook the bacon until crisp. Add the pasta, zucchini, thyme, and crushed red pepper flakes, to the skillet. Cook 5 minutes. Add the avocado sauce and parmesan, tossing well to combine, adding pasta water to thin the sauce as needed. Season with salt and pepper. Stir in a handful of fresh herbs. .
Divide the pasta among plates and top with parmesan and basil. Enjoy!
.

Simple Coconut Quinoa and Lentil Curry with Lime Mango. My favorite winter curry. Ever. it's healthy, quick and SO GOOD. Enough said. .
.
2 tablespoons coconut oil
2 red bell peppers, chopped
2-3 carrots, chopped
2 cloves garlic, minced or grated
1 tablespoon fresh ginger, grated
2-3 tablespoons thai red curry paste (I like to use 3)
1 tablespoons curry powder (I like using spicy curry powder)
1 (14 ounce ounce) can full fat coconut milk
4 cups coconut water OR vegetable broth OR water
1 tablespoon fish sauce or soy sauce if vegan
1 cup green lentils, rinsed
1 cup mixed red and white quinoa
3-4 big handful baby kale
juice + zest from 1/2 a lemon
1/4 cup fresh cilantro + basil, chopped
1 mango, sliced or chopped
1 lime, zest + juice
fresh naan, greek yogurt, fresno chiles + almonds, for topping
.
.
Heat the coconut oil in a large heavy bottomed pot set over medium heat. Once hot, add the red pepper and carrots, cook 2-3 minutes or until lightly charred on the edges. Add the garlic + ginger and cook 30 seconds. Add the thai red curry paste and curry powder, continue cooking for another minute or until the curry is fragrant. Slowly pour in the coconut milk, coconut water (or broth or just water) and fish sauce or soy sauce. Stir to combine and then bring the mixture to a boil. Once boiling, stir in the lentils and quinoa. Reduce the heat to a simmer, cover and cook for 20-25 minutes or until the lentils are tender and the quinoa soft. Stir in the kale and continue cooking, uncovered for another 5 minutes. Remove from the heat the and stir in the lemon juice + zest, the cilantro and basil.
Ladle the curry into bowls and top with mango. Drizzle the mango with lime juice + zest. Garnish the curry the with a dollop of greek yogurt, fresno chilies and almonds. Serve with fresh naan. EAT.
.
.
