Whole Wheat Spinach and Artichoke Pizza. 🙌  Because Monday night should most definitely involve cheesy pizza...but it's cool because this pizza is whole wheat making it totally healthy...😉 .
.
TO MAKE:
Preheat oven to 425 degrees F. Grease a baking sheet with olive oil.
.
On a lightly floured surface, push/roll 1/2 pound whole wheat pizza dough out until it is very thin. Transfer the dough to the prepared baking sheet. Spread the dough with 1/4 cup olive oil. Add 3-4 cloves chopped garlic garlic, zest of 1 lemon lemon zest, 1 teaspoons dried basil, a pinch each of salt, pepper, and crushed red pepper flakes. Spread evenly over the dough. Add 2 cups fresh spinach, 1 (12 ounce) jar marinated artichokes, and 8 ounces mozzarella cheese. Top with lemon slices. Transfer to the oven and bake 10-15 minutes or until the crust is crisp and the cheese has melted. Remove the pizza from the oven and top with basil and microgreens. EAT!

Simple Greek Quinoa Dinner Omelets with Feta and Tzatziki. Because breakfast for dinner is always the best. Grab the recipe below. .
.
For the Quinoa
1 1/2 cup cooked quinoa
1 cup fresh spinach chopped
1/2 cup pitted mixed Greek olives
1/4 cup red roasted red peppers, marinated artichoke hearts + sun-dried tomatoes
1 teaspoon dried oregano
1 teaspoon dried basil
kosher salt and pepper
crumbed feta cheese (as much as you want)
.
For the Omelet
6 large eggs
2 tablespoons butter
.
.
To make the quinoa, add all ingredients to a bowl and toss well.
.
To make the omelet, whisk together the eggs and a pinch each of salt and pepper. Whisk in fresh herbs).
.
Heat a large skillet over medium-low heat. Once the pan is hot add 1 tablespoon of butter and swirl the pan to coat. Pour in half of the egg mixture and let it set for about 10 to 20 seconds. Use a heat-safe spatula to gently move the set eggs toward the middle of the pan, then tilt the pan so runny eggs take their place. Sprinkle the quinoa on one side of the omelet. Fold the other half over the quinoa. Repeat with the remaining eggs.
.
Top each omelet with Tzatziki, avocado, pine nuts, and basil. EAT! .

Cajun Garlic Lemon Butter Shrimp with Caramelized Corn Polenta 😍😍 Let’s talk about this big bowl of comfort right here. Honestly, this is what late summer dinner perfection looks like. It is delicious...but then, how could anything covered in garlic, lemon, and butter not be insanely amazing!? --> spoon the saucy shrimp over top the creamy polenta...yummmm. Spicy, buttery, slightly cheesy…and filled with summer corn and fresh basil --> make this 👊
.
*for the polenta*
4 tablespoons butter
3 ears sweet corn, kernels removed from the cob
1 1/2 cups milk
1 cup dry instant polenta
1/2 cup grated parmesan cheese
salt and pepper
.
*for the shrimp*
4 tablespoons butter
1 pound shrimp, peeled, deveined, tail on or off
1 tablespoon cajun seasoning
black pepper
2 cloves garlic, minced or grated
1 cup fresh basil
juice from 1 lemon
.
Cook the butter and corn together until the corn has browned lightly and is caramelized. Add 1 1/2 cups water and the milk and bring to a low boil. Whisk in the polenta and cook 5 minutes until thickened. Stir in the parmesan cheese and season with salt and pepper to taste.
.
Heat a large skillet over medium heat and add the butter, shrimp, seasonings and a large pinch of pepper. Cook until the shrimp is cooked through. Stir in the garlic and cook 1 minutes more. Remove from the heat and stir in the basil and lemon juice.
.
Serve the shrimp over the polenta, spooning any sauce left in the pan over the shrimp. EAT! 😋
.

The only veggie burger recipe you will ever need 👉 crispy quinoa burgers topped with sweet potato fries and beer caramelized onions. the bestest burger. for real. bring on game day 👊
.
What you need
2 cups cooked red quinoa
1 cup cooked black beans, mashed
1/2 cup panko bread crumbs
1 large egg, lightly beaten
1 clove garlic, grated
1 teaspoon chipotle chile powder
1/2 teaspoon salt
1/2 teaspoon peper
3/4 cup sharp cheddar cheese, shredded
3 tablespoons olive oil
4 burger buns
sweet potato fries + caramelized onions (recipes on the site)
.
In a bowl combine the quinoa, mashed cannellini beans, bread crumbs, egg, garlic, chipotle chile powder, salt and pepper. Mix well to moisten the ingredients and then mix in the shredded cheddar cheese. Mix well again and form into 4 or 5 equal burger patties.
Heat large skillet with a drizzle of olive oil. Add the quinoa burgers and cook until golden and crisp, about 5 minutes per side. During the last minute of cooking add a handful of cheese, cover the pan and cook 2-3 minutes.
Assemble
Place each burger on a bun, top with equal amounts of caramelized onions and sweet potato fries. If desired add an egg. Enjoy!
.
.

Strawberry Chamomile Paloma. 🍓 Spring in a cocktail glass and it's so dang good. Chamomile honey syrup, grapefruit juice, fresh strawberries, TEQUILA, and topped with lot's of fizz. Perfection. ✨
.
Chamomile Honey Syrup:
Pour 3/4 cup boiling water over 2 chamomile tea bags. Add 1/3 cup honey, stir and then seep for 10 minutes. Remove the teas bags and cool. .
.
To Make the Paloma:
3 ounces fresh grapefruit juice (about 1/2 a grapefruit)
2-4 tablespoons chamomile honey syrup
2 ounces tequila (omit to make a virgin)
4 fresh strawberries, sliced
sparkling water for topping off
.
Add the grapefruit juice, chamomile syrup, tequila and strawberries to a glass. Using a muddler gently push the strawberries down until they release their juices. Add a handful of ice and then add sparkling water to top off. Give the drink a gentle stir. Make all pretty with fresh chamomile flowers. 🌼 🌼 Enjoy 🙃

You guys. You guys. I made Homemade Vegetable Potstickers (with Toasted Sesame Honey Soy Sauce) and they are seriously the best thing ever. THE BEST. That's really all you need to know. Grab the full recipe below and enjoy! ..
.
For the Potstickers
2 tablespoons sesame oil
1 inch fresh ginger, grated
8 ounces shiitake mushrooms, chopped
1 cup shredded cabbage
1 cup shredded carrots
2 tablespoons low sodium soy sauce or tamari
2 tablespoons chopped fresh chives
2 tablespoons toasted sesame seeds
36-40 wonton wrappers

Cook the veggies in oil until softened. Add the soy sauce, chives, and sesame seeds and cook another 2-3 minutes or until all the liquid has evaporated.

To assemble, spoon the filling onto each wrapper. Brush water around the edge of the wrapper. Fold the dough over the filling to create a half moon shape, pinching the edges to seal. Repeat with the remaining wrappers.
Pan fry the potstickers  in oil and then add water, cover and steam for 3 minutes.

For the sauce, combine, 1 clove garlic, 1/3 cup rice vinegar, 1/4 cup toasted sesame oil, 1-2 tablespoons Gochujang (Korean chili paste), 2 tablespoons soy sauce,  and 1 tablespoon honey. Serve with potstickers. EAT!
.
.

Heirloom Tomato Cheddar Tart with Everything Spice...SO delicious! And it’s SOOO easy. All you need is puff pastry, basil pesto, cheddar cheese, tomatoes, olive oil and then that magical everything bagel spice. It really just doesn’t get any simpler or more 😋😋
.
*your ingredients*
1 sheet frozen puff pasty, thawed
1/3 cup basil pesto
1 1/2 cups shredded sharp cheddar cheese
4-6 heirloom tomatoes, sliced
olive oil, for drizzling
everything bagel spice (homemade mix on the blog) .
.
Place the pasty on a baking sheet and prick with the tines of a fork. Spread the pesto over the dough and top with cheddar cheese. Bake in a 425 degree oven for 25-30 minutes or until the pastry is golden.
.
Top the tart with tomatoes. Drizzle lightly with olive oil and sprinkle generously with everything bagel spice. Top with basil. Slice and EAT! 🙂
.

Easy Classic Hummus just in time for Mother’s Day tomorrow! NOTHING beats homemade hummus and it’s so simple and quick to make at home yourself. Make a big batch today for Mother’s Day tomorrow and then eat leftovers all week long for snacking + quick healthy meals!! Mother’s Day eats and weekday meal prep all in one! 👊 RECIPE:
1 3/4 cups cooked chickpeas (about one 14 ounce can)
2-4 cloves garlic (depending on your taste)
1/3 cup tahini (sesame seed paste)
1/3 cup olive oil
juice from 1 lemon
1 tablespoon white miso paste or 3/4 teaspoon kosher salt

If time allows, peel the skins away from the chickpeas. This really makes for the most perfect, creamy hummus and takes only about 10 minutes to do!

To the bowl of a food processor, add the chickpeas and garlic, pulse until finely ground and the chickpeas are powdery. Add the tahini, olive oil, lemon juice, miso paste or salt. Puree until smooth. With the machine running, stream in 1 tablespoon water a time until the hummus as reached a creamy consistency. Taste and adjust salt + lemon as needed.
Spoon into a bowl and serve drizzled with olive oil and sprinkled with your favorite seasoning. I love using smoked paprika. Oh and eat with pita chips!!

Homemade Poutine. Real deal french fries, cheese curds (THE BEST PART) and piping hot gravy. cozy winter food ✔️ game day food ✔️hangover food ✔️perfection ✔️ Recipe below. .
.
4 pounds russet potatoes, cut into 1/4 inch matchsticks
4 tablespoons unsalted butter
1/4 cup flour
1/2 onions, chopped
1 clove garlic, minced or grated
3 1/2 cups low sodium beef stock
1 tablespoon balsamic vinegar
2 teaspoons worcestershire sauce
2 tablespoons ketchup
kosher salt and pepper
oil, for frying
3 cups cheddar cheese curds
.
.
Make the gravy. Melt the butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add flour, and cook, stirring, until smooth. Add the onion and garlic, and cook, until fragrant. Add the stock, beer, ketchup, balsamic, worcestershire, and a each pinch of salt and pepper. Bring to a boil and cook, stirring, until thickened. Keep warm
.
Pour oil into a 6-qt. Dutch oven, filling it about 3 inches up the sides. Heat over medium heat until a deep-fry thermometer reads 375 degrees F. Working in small batches, add potatoes and fry, tossing occasionally, until tender and slightly crisp, about 4-6 minutes. Remove from the oil and drain on paper towels. Sprinkle with salt.
.
Divide the fries among bowls. Add cheese curds and piping hot gravy. Dig in immediately. Obviously. .
.

Sweet roasted spaghetti squash, spicy-ish tomato sauce, and all the cheese. These roasted garlic spaghetti squash lasagna boats are my one of my favorite recipes on the site. best cozy, but healthy dinner. 👏
.
.
to make:
4-6 small spaghetti squash, halved lengthwise
1 tablespoon olive oil
1 head garlic
1 pounds spicy Italian chicken (or 1 pound ground chicken)
4 ounces pancetta, finely chopped
1/2 a sweet onion, finely chopped
1 bay leaf
1 teaspoon fresh thyme (1/2 teaspoon dried)
1 teaspoon fresh sage (1/2 teaspoon dried)
1 tablespoon fresh basil ( 2 teaspoons dried)
1/2 teaspoon kosher salt + pepper
1 (28 ounce) can crushed tomatoes
3 tablespoons butter
3 tablespoons flour
1 1/4 cup milk
1/8 teaspoon nutmeg
3/4 cup provolone cheese, shredded
1 cup shredded mozzarella cheese
.
.
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.
Roast both the garlic and squash until tender.
While the squash bakes make the sauce. In a large skillet, cook 1 tablespoon of olive oil and the pancetta over medium heat, stirring, until the pancetta is lightly browned, about 5 minutes. Add the onion, bay leaf, thyme and sage and cook, stirring until the veggies are softened, about 5 minutes. Push to the veggies to the side of the pan. Increase the heat to medium-high. Add 1 tablespoon olive oil to the center of the pan and crumble in the chicken sausage and cook without stirring for 3 minutes. Break up the meat and continue to cook, stirring occasionally until well browned, about 3 minutes. Add the tomatoes, basil and 1 cup water to the skillet. Simmer, stirring occasionally until thickened, about 15-20 minutes. Once the sauce has thicken a bit, discard the bay leaf and season with salt and pepper. Remove from the heat and stir in the mashed garlic.
Meanwhile, in a medium saucepan, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the flour and cook, whisking constantly, for 1 minute. Whisk in the milk in a steady stream and simmer for 2 minutes, whisking throughout. Remove from the heat, stir in all of the provolone and season with nutmeg, salt and pepper.
Layer the meat sauce, cheese sauce and cheese inside the squash. Bake for 20-30 minutes. EAT. .
.
